Function Documentation

int vslcl_call_function ( int  fid,
int *  param 
)

Execute function on remote node.

Parameters:
fid An integer value specifying the requested function id
param An integer pointer pointing to an array of integer values representing the operands required for the function call. One has to assure that there is enough space (i.e. PL_OPERAND_COUNT elements) for the array!
Returns:
Zero if function executed successfully, error code otherwise

int vslcl_Close ( void   ) 

Close the library.

Returns:
Zero if successfully closed library, nonzero otherwise
vslcl_Close() will close the library if it was previuosly opened and sets iVSLCLStatus to OFF. If the library is not already opened, vslcl_Close() will return an error code.

int  op2,
int *  result 
)

Call divide function.

Parameters:
op1 Operand 1, an integer value
op2 Operand 2, an integer value
result An integer pointer pointing to a variable the result is to be written to
Returns:
Zero if successfully executed, error code otherwise

Here is the call graph for this function:

int vslcl_Open ( void   ) 

Initialize vslab client library.

Returns:
Zero if successfully opened socket, error code otherwise
vslcl_Open() will start initialization of the vslab client library and should be called at the beginning of any program that wants to access the remote node. vslcl_Open() will return zero if successfully executed and an error code less than zero otherwise.

Definition at line 117 of file vslabclib.c.

int vslcl_SetUnicastAddress ( char *  address  ) 

Set the remote unicast address.

Parameters:
address A string representing the unicast address to be used by vslcl_Open().
Returns:
Zero if successfully executed, nonzero otherwise
vslcl_SetUnicastAddress() sets the unicast address used by the library. It has to be called BEFOFE vslcl_Open()! The function returns zero if successfully executed and an error code otherwise.

Definition at line 311 of file vslabclib.c.
